item.title: How to be a great supervisor (of an internship)?
item.description: In my previous post I discussed how to be a great intern, now I’ll try to provide a complementary view on how I think a great supervisor should do. Trade-offs One of the most difficult parts of being a good supervisor is deciding what role you need to play during the internship to maximize both the intern’s interests and yours. For example, as a supervisor you can “force” the intern to work on your project/ideas, but if the intern is not interested it’s going to be a huge loss of time and effort (for both).

item.title: How to be a great intern?
item.description: Tips and suggestions to make the most of an internship in tech. Note: My experience is with research internships where the final outcome could be a paper submission. Expectations The first key aspect to understand are the expectations of your internship (both for you and your supervisor).

About Hi, I’m Pablo, I’m currently a machine learning researcher at Borealis AI which is part of RBC (Royal Bank of Canada) in Toronto, Canada. I’ve worked on fundamental research in multiagent deep reinforcement learning (for example in this NeurIPS Pommerman competition), auxiliary tasks for Deep RL and robustness in RL. During this time I had the pleasure to work with Matthew E. Taylor (now at U of Alberta). In terms of applied research I have worked on explainability for an RL agent that is trading in markets.
